page.title: 19CHILDREN'S PASTIMES, SWANSEA
page.content: The favourite pastime is watching television. 85% of the children said that they spend 3-5 hours viewing each day. Video films are popular but owning a video recorder is kept secret in case it is stolen. 46% of the children play computer games, but only 5% have educational programmes. Infant children play lots of 'let's pretend' games, usually based on TV programmes. 25% say that they play lots of tag and skipping games. Older boys play foot- ball all year round. There are no local clubs so boys have to leave the area to join teams. Only 20% of the children belong to organisations like Brownies or Cubs. There are no groups like these in the immediate area. Only 30% go out of the area for leisure activities. Most children hang around the roads or our school buildings. We all wish we had a club to go to.
